meanings.definition: Appoint or specify (someone) to a specified position or role.
meanings.sent1: The manager will designate a new team leader.
meanings.sent2: Please designate a meeting time that works for everyone.
meanings.sent3: I will designate you as the official taste tester for the cookies.
meanings.sent4: Her bright smile designates her as the friendliest person in the room.
meanings.sent5: The golden badge designates the sheriff in this town.

meanings.definition: Indicate or specify (something) as being necessary or required.
meanings.sent1: The sign will designate the entrance to the park.
meanings.sent2: The doctor will designate the medication you need to take.
meanings.sent3: I will designate the chocolate cake as the best dessert on the menu.
meanings.sent4: The red flag designates danger ahead on the road.
meanings.sent5: The loud alarm designates the start of the race.

meanings.definition: Identify or distinguish (someone or something) in a particular way.
meanings.sent1: The special hat designates him as the team captain.
meanings.sent2: The unique symbol will designate the secret meeting location.
meanings.sent3: I will designate the purple flower as my favorite in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The bright colors designate the children's section in the library.
meanings.sent5: The loud roar designates the arrival of the king.
